text: Karah Borni Mosque (), was a Tunisian mosque located in the medina of Tunis. It does not exist anymore. Mohamed Belkhodja, Tārīkh maʻālim al-tawḥīd fī al- qadīm wa-fī al-Jadīd, Tunis, al-Maṭbaʻah al-Tūnisīyah, 1939, 429 p == Localization== The mosque was located in Sidi El Agha Street. == Etymology== The word Borni means black in Turkish while Karah means Hawk. == History== According to the observers, the mosque was built during the Ottoman reign. == References == Category:Mosques in Tunis
title: Karah Borni Mosque
